net.java.dev.designgridlayout
Interface ISpannableGridRow

All Superinterfaces:
IGridRow, IRow, ISubGridStarter
public interface ISpannableGridRow
extends IGridRow

Rows created by DesignGridLayout.row().grid() and DesignGridLayout.row().grid(JLabel) implement this interface. Through this interface, in addition to methods inherited from IGridRow, you can specify components spanning multiple rows with the new spanRow() method.

Author:
Jean-Francois Poilpret

Method Detail

spanRow

ISpannableGridRow spanRow()
Specifies that the next grid column will be filled with the same component in the same column location in the row above this row.

Calling spanRow() in one row behaves as follows:

  1. the component on the previous row at the same column position in the same sub-grid will span this row
  2. the horizontal span of this component will be the same as the column span defined for that same component on the previous row
  3. the sub-grid in which spanRow() appears will have its gridspan forced to the same value as the sub-grid in the same position of the previous row
  4. if the matching component in the previous row is IGridRow.empty() or IGridRow.empty(int), then spanRow() is also empty() or empty(int)
  5. if this is the first row in the layout, then spanRow() is replaced with a marker component, used for fixing the layout
  6. if there is no grid row above this row, then spanRow() will be replaced with a marker component, used for fixing the layout
  7. if there is no matching subgrid (same position) in the above row, then spanRow() will be replaced with a marker component, used for fixing the layout
  8. if there is no matching component (same position) in the matching subgrid of the above row, then spanRow() will be replaced with a marker component, used for fixing the layout
  9. if the matching subgrid in the above row does not have the same number of columns of the current subgrid in this row, then spanRow() will be replaced with a marker component, used for fixing the layout

A marker component is used to show bad calls to spanRow() which could not be avoided at compile-time. This marker is a "spanRow()" label with a red background and a tooltip giving more details about the actual problem.

Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)

add

ISpannableGridRow add(JComponent... children)
Description copied from interface: IRow
Adds components to this row; each component has its own "column" in the row. Components are added left to right, in the same order as they appear in the arguments list.

Specified by:
add in interface IGridRow
Specified by:
add in interface IRow
Parameters:
children - components to add to this row
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)

add

ISpannableGridRow add(JComponent child,
                      int span)
Description copied from interface: IGridRow
Adds one component to this row and allows it to span several columns of the canonical grid.

The order of calls match the order in which the components will be added to this row. Components are added left to right, in the same order as they appear in the arguments list.

Specified by:
add in interface IGridRow
Parameters:
child - component to add to this row; it is added to the right of the component that was added by the nearest previous call to an add method.
span - the number of columns to span (must be > 0)
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)

addMulti

ISpannableGridRow addMulti(JComponent... children)
Description copied from interface: IRow
Adds components to this row; all components are "assembled" as one global component and use only one "column" in the row.

Note that the width of each individual component will never grow bigger than its preferred width.

Specified by:
addMulti in interface IGridRow
Specified by:
addMulti in interface IRow
Parameters:
children - components to assemble and add to this row
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)

addMulti

ISpannableGridRow addMulti(int span,
                           JComponent... children)
Description copied from interface: IGridRow
Adds components to this row; all components are "assembled" as one global component and span a given number of columns in the row.

Note that the width of each individual component will never grow bigger than its preferred width.

Specified by:
addMulti in interface IGridRow
Parameters:
span - the number of columns to span (must be > 0)
children - components to assemble and add to this row
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)
